title: sofie
subtitle: bumped into the actual Cersei in London where she was promoting gifts that help refugees. My poor queer brain imploded, I forgot to tell her that I wanted her babies and instead jogged swiftly away without helping the refugees, which also made me look like a right dick. pic.twitter.com/sxOLR8dFUh

title: RESHMA RUIA
subtitle: My beautiful copy of the anthology #NoGoodDeed with my story Cooking Chicken in Kentucky published by @RetreatWest. All proceeds go towards Indigo Volunteers helping refugees. Please support by picking a copy. pic.twitter.com/6b9TD54QqQ

title: Governance for Africa
Filippo Grandi
subtitle:
Wishing success to Ursula @vonderleyen and her team.

The @EU_Commission must continue to play a key role in refugee matters: asylum in Europe, resettlement, aid to refugee hosting countries, solutions to forced displacement. 

We at UNHCR look forward to a strong partnership. pic.twitter.com/CJB4TeKuhS

title: Hammersmith Quakers
subtitle: Knitting blankets from wool scraps at our partner charity West London Welcome today. The blankets go to our local refugees and asylum seekers. pic.twitter.com/vbECA9P0ZK

title: Palest Return Centre
subtitle: #Ireland has announced a EUR 2.5 million contribution in funding to the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA). pic.twitter.com/0JKZqCF8YY

title: FinlandGeneva
subtitle: UNHCR is a valued partner for Finland. We’ll continue support and close cooperation in 2020 - both through humanitarian funding and by offering an increased number of resettlement places. #Finland pledged today 20 million EUR to UNHCR in 2020 @refugees @Ulkoministeriopic.twitter.com/dJuxlE0HXy – at Palais des Nations

title: International Trade Centre
subtitle:
After Dadaab and Kakuma, Kenya), ITC's Refugee Employment and Skills Initiative is expanding to Hargeisa, Somalia.

Together with the Shaqodoon Organization, we train refugees and internally-displaced persons in online freelancing.

title: NACCOM
subtitle: On #GivingTuesday, we wanted to give a shout out to all the incredible charities in our network (over 100+) who work hard every single day to support people seeking asylum, refugees and many others out of destitution, and who fight tirelessly for a more humane asylum system. pic.twitter.com/MrGF38xkGC

title: Nuria Diez Guardia
subtitle: Starting discussion of housing issues young refugees face, with young woman who came alone at age 17. She carried out survey for Brussels parliament on housing situation: when expertise, personal experience, commitment, and participation meet ⁦@EURightsAgency⁩pic.twitter.com/IeXuG2RQ0W

title: Surrey Music
subtitle: Fantastic news! Our retiring collection on Saturday raised an amazing £708 for Elmbridge CAN. Charity Trustee, Steve, gave a very moving and inspiring talk about the work of the charity which welcomes, settles and supports refugees in the area. http://www.elmbridgecan.org.uk  #elmbridgepic.twitter.com/JJmHMX9GRt

subtitle: Share your best ideas for helping refugees. We are listening!  pic.twitter.com/WOANPKpTwP

title: Kirstie Whitaker
subtitle: Excited to open the first door of James’ & my #AdventOfChange calendar! It cost us £30 and we find out where the money is spent each day. Today money went to @refugeecouncil who (among other things) provide study materials to child refugees. https://adventofchange.com/day1 pic.twitter.com/Ol70ev9Pp1
